::SnowCat::

She looked at Lunarpine for a second.  She wasn't sure if she 
believed him or not, but he was a maximal and there for worthy for a 
chance.  She motioned him into the room where Ramulus was. "Ramulus, 
This bot wishes to speak to you for a moment.  Let me know when you 
are ready to engage your plan and I'll be there."  She walked out of 
the room and went down the hall tot he burned out computer room.  She 
looked around for a minute at the burned and charred remains of hte 
computers. "Hey, Iris? Do any of the autoguns still work? We may need 
them later on."



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> Lunarpine wasn't threatened by this new aquaintance, he knew his 
new form
> could easily overpower her but he'd leave the fighting for the 
predacons.
> "No I'm not from the Cybertronian Fire, I was protecting this 
scrapheap for
> a while until I found a purpose. I went on long range recon and now 
I'm
> back. Now either walk with me to Ramulus or step aside and let me 
by."
> Lunarpine didn't intend to sound cocky but he had business to 
attend to and
> wasn't in the mood for the witty game of 20 questions.
